website_summaries.verdict: Pricey, but these doors will look great in many different bathroom decors.
pros: Available in either a chrome or brushed nickel finish
Uses smaller handles than other sliding bathtub doors, which some people will like
Uses quarter-inch clear tempered glass for safety
Door slides easily, as long as the installation process is completed correctly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sliding Door
customer_reviews.text: We bought the the frosted Model a few weeks, ago, and had it installed. We are very happy with this purchase for a few reasons. First, if you look at one of the pictures, look at the rollers, no more Soap scum, the two doors slide very easily and lock with a magnet, which I think is a very nice touch. It's very sturdy, and looks classy. I'm not one for the traditional sliding door, so I was very glad to have found this product, plus the No Soap Scum on the bottom is a pet peeve of mine.
customer_reviews.author: AliG

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect, I was told I couldn't put shower doors in my 1900's bathroom, found this and took a chance, so glad I did. My brother and I had this installed in 4 hrs, yes very proud of ourselves. it fit and works perfect. I finally have lots of light in my shower, I put a white clingy plastics film on portion of the outside of the doors leaving a 5 to 6 inch gap at top; for some privacy.Its beautiful, so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Modern!
customer_reviews.text: So pleased with this purchase! We completely renovated our bathroom and decided we wanted a glass sliding door instead of curtains so we could show off the shower. We feel that this door was very reasonably priced with great reviews. My husband and cousin were able to install it on their own in one afternoon and it’s perfect! We love it! And the doors are magnetic so that was a nice surprise! We did have some issues with leaking in the beginning but we added more caulk and that did the trick! I think that was more on our end though and not the door. Overall very happy!
customer_reviews.author: HalesComet

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, lots of compliments
customer_reviews.text: The installation instructions were hard to follow and I’m a pretty good handyman. The problem is after it’s cut to size, there’s little or no space left to properly seal the bottom and sides because it goes in as one big piece. After caulking the edges several times, it still leaked. Had to totally remove the entire enclosure, disassemble and slightly trim all three edges, then reinstall with lots of extra silicon. The totally time was maybe 16 hours, but with hindsight and better instructions, should have only taken half that time. Looks great, but a real pain to install.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: A Fine Looking Shower Door
customer_reviews.text: The door was easily installed...by my handyman. It looks smart, but not as contemporary as the doors that are truly frameless and suspended from above. It is lighter in scale than the usual by-pass design. The bottom of the frame is high, so that when mounted on my relatively deep tub, it requires a surprisingly high step to enter/exit; something one gets used to quickly. The quality of the unit appears to be very good. Cleaning the glass is simplified by using Cleaning Vinegar and a wiper. No water escapes through the door.
customer_reviews.author: Albert G.

customer_reviews.title: Not for the do it yourselfer!
customer_reviews.text: While this is a very well made and unique shower door system, it is not a do it yourselfer job! I hired a pro and it took him over 4 hours. One thing they don't tell you is that if your tub unit has a slight curve at the bottom of the opening you will have to file the metal corners of the rail to get it to fit properly! It is a 90* angle at the bottom of the track, so unless you have a 90* corner, be prepared to make an alteration by filing the metal...after all that it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: morey

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and good looking too!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, well-made product that looks great and works just like it should. Installation is time-consuming but not beyond the capabilities of an experienced do-it-yourselfer, and contrary to what some other reviewers have said, the instructions do explain the key measurements. I'm glad I purchased this & recommend it highly as a cost-effective way of upgrading your tub shower.
customer_reviews.author: Hotrock

customer_reviews.title: very neat design
customer_reviews.text: always had a problem with other sliding doors that don't close even, or the kids leave them open at one end, and the water gets to the wall and on the tiled floor. this design prevents that, the way it opens, and closes in the middle. then holds together with the strong magnetic clips. had some problems when first installing it, but when I called dreamLine they were more than helpful on the phone, and the doors work wonderfully. not a drop of water anywhere except in the shower and tub where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: mad russian

customer_reviews.title: Comparison of 2 doors.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bathtub door and another style. The doors on this are sooo much easier. Can bathe a baby or pet and the double doors make it easy to step in and out. This door was about $140 less and i like it better. The fancier single panel slide door was more frameless and heavier glass. Installation was difficult and expensive for both doors but the frameless one was harder to have installed due to weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kalint

customer_reviews.title: Installation went pretty smooth. I goofed on the drill size for ...
customer_reviews.text: Installation went pretty smooth. I goofed on the drill size for the wall anchors so I had to up size them and get bigger anchors/screws. Not a big deal just a trip to the HW store. Double check the size spec'd against the provided anchors, could have been an error there, I never went back an checked? I love the unit itself. It has helped seal the tub up so the kids splashing stays in where it's supposed to. I like the center opening vs. the traditional side to side opening. Looks great too. So far it's holding up well after a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Elegant. Beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: Elegant. It was the piece that was missing to make our bath space incredible. The doors close at the middle with magnets. It glides easily to each side. customer_reviews.title: Many adjustments need to be made to the doors and stops to make them work as they were designed to to make a perfect seal. Very
customer_reviews.text: Low rating due to the doors not sealing together thoroughly. Plastic trim pieces that snap on to cover exposed parts inside the shower do not stay on very well. Many adjustments need to be made to the doors and stops to make them work as they were designed to to make a perfect seal. Very tedious and aggravating! Would not purchase again!! Do not recommend.
